meanings.sent1: The lush, green forest was a nondesert area.
meanings.sent2: The park was a nondesert place with plenty of trees and flowers.
meanings.sent3: The rainy day made the usually dry land nondesert-like.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a nondesert oasis in the midst of selfishness.
meanings.sent5: The colorful garden was a nondesert paradise for butterflies.

meanings.definition: To not abandon or leave someone or something behind
meanings.sent1: She promised to nondesert her friend during tough times.
meanings.sent2: The loyal dog would never nondesert its owner, no matter what.
meanings.sent3: I will nondesert my umbrella this time; I always forget it at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was so strong that he would nondesert his goals.
meanings.sent5: The captain made a vow to nondesert his crew, no matter the storm ahead.
